hecbayes 2023.10.15
  • Reference

    Update for Markov chain Monte Carlo

    mh.Rd

    This function computes a single update for a Metropolis-Hastings algorithm for univariate proposal based on random walk, adjusted Langevin dynamics with gradient or a quadratic Laplace approximation.

    mh(
  type = c("rw", "mala", "laplace"),
  par_curr,
  par_name,
  loglik,
  loglik_grad = NULL,
  loglik_hessian = NULL,
  logprior,
  logprior_grad = NULL,
  logprior_hessian = NULL,
  lb = -Inf,
  ub = Inf,
  transform = FALSE,
  damping = 1,
  sd_prop,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    type

    [string] update type, either random walk (rw), adjusted Langevin (mala) or quadratic approximation (laplace)

    par_curr

    [double] current value of the parameter

    par_name

    [string] the name of the argument for the function

    loglik

    [function] log likelihood function

    loglik_grad

    [function] derivative of the log likelihood with respect to parameter of interest

    loglik_hessian

    [function] second derivative of the log likelihood with respect to the parameter of interest

    logprior

    [function] log prior of parameter

    logprior_grad

    [function] derivative of the log prior with respect to parameter of interest

    logprior_hessian

    [function] second derivative of the log prior with respect to the parameter of interest

    lb

    [scalar] lower bound for the parameter

    ub

    [scalar] upper bound for the parameter

    transform

    [logical] should the parameter be mapped onto the real line (TRUE) or should proposals be made based on truncated distributions (FALSE)

    damping

    [scalar] contraction factor for the Newton update

    sd_prop

    [double] standard deviation of the proposal

    ...

    additional arguments passed to the log likelihood function and its derivatives

    Value

    value of the parameter

    Contents

    Developed by Leo Belzile.
